sen.j: 『熊野』（ゆや）は、能を代表する曲の一つである。
sen.e: "Yuya" is one of the best Noh play pieces.
"Yuya" is one of the most representative Noh pieces.
"Yuya" is one of the most representative Noh pieces.

sen.j: 作者は、金春禅竹とも言われるが不明。
sen.e: The playwright is unknown although some say it is Zenchiku KONPARU.
The playwright is unknown although some say it is Zenchiku KONPARU.
The playwright is unknown although some say it is Zenchiku KONPARU.

sen.j: 禅竹の著書『歌舞髄脳記』に『遊屋』の記述がある。
sen.e: "Yuya" is described on "Kabuzuinoki" (The Essence of Dance and Song) written by Zenchiku.
"Yuya" is described on "Kabuzuinoki" (The Essence of Dance and Song) written by Zenchiku.
"Yuya" is described on "Kabuzuinoki" (The Essence of Dance and Song) written by Zenchiku.

sen.j: 喜多流では『湯谷』。
sen.e: "Yuya" is written in different kanji characters at the Kita school.
"Yuya" is written in different kanji characters at the Kita school.
"Yuya" is written in different kanji characters at the Kita school.

sen.j: 『平家物語』の巻十「海道下」（かいどうくだり）の場面から発展させたと考えられる。
sen.e: It seemingly expands on the scenes from "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike) Vol.10 'Kaidokudari.'
It seemingly expands on the scenes from "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike) Vol.10 'Kaidokudari.'
It seemingly expands on the scenes from "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike) Vol.10 'Kaidokudari.'

sen.j: 作中で「自分と同じ名前だ」として熊野権現、今熊野（いまぐまの）を挙げている。
sen.e: In the play, Kumano Gongen Deity and Imagumano are mentioned as 'the same name as mine.'
In the play, the deity Kumano Gongen and Imagumano are mentioned as 'having the same name as me.'
sen.cmt: Deityの順序を変えました。The same name as mineをhaving the same name as meに変えました。
sen.e: In the play, the deity Kumano Gongen and Imagumano are mentioned as 'having the same name as me.'

sen.j: つまりは喜多流以外では主人公は「くまの」さんだと思われるが、ここでは音読みで「ゆや」と読む。
sen.e: Therefore, the main character's name is probably 'Kumano,' except in the Kita school although it is called 'Yuya' based on on-yomi (Chinese reading of kanji) here.
Therefore, the main character's name is probably 'Kumano,' except in the Kita school, although it is called 'Yuya' based on on-yomi (Chinese reading of kanji) here.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: Therefore, the main character's name is probably 'Kumano,' except in the Kita school, although it is called 'Yuya' based on on-yomi (Chinese reading of kanji) here.

sen.j: ドラマチックな展開を可能とする素材を扱いながら、対立的な描写を行わない。
sen.e: Although it may be dramatic because of its theme, it is not described confrontationally.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Although it deals with material that could have dramatic developments, it does not become confrontational.
Although it deals with material that could have dramatic developments, it does not become confrontational.

sen.j: 春の風景の中、主人公の心の動きをゆるやかな過程で追う。
sen.e: Feelings of the main character are gently described in spring sceneries.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It gently follows the main character's mood changes through spring sceneries.
sen.cmt: 自然な英語の順序に変えました。
sen.e: It gently follows the main character's mood changes through spring sceneries.

sen.j: いかにも能らしい能として、古来「熊野松風に米の飯」（『熊野』と『松風 (能)』は名曲で、米飯と同じく何度観ても飽きず、噛めば噛む程味が出る、の意）と賞賛されてきた。
sen.e: As a true Noh play, it has been praised since ancient times as "Yuya and Matsukaze are like cooked rice" (meaning, "Yuya" and "Matsukaze" are true master pieces; they are tasty like cooked rice and never boring).

As a genuine Noh play among all Noh plays, it has long been praised in the phrase "Yuya and Matsukaze (Noh play) are like cooked rice" (meaning "Yuya" and "Matsukeze" are masterpieces and just like cooked rice – never boring no matter how many times you eat it, in fact tastier with every chew).

As a genuine Noh play among all Noh plays, it has long been praised in the phrase "Yuya and Matsukaze (Noh play) are like cooked rice" (meaning "Yuya" and "Matsukeze" are masterpieces and just like cooked rice – never boring no matter how many times you eat it, in fact tastier with every chew).

sen.j: 時は平家の全盛期、ワキ（平宗盛）の威勢の良い名乗りで幕を開ける。
sen.e: It is the heyday of the Taira family; the play starts with a spirited nanori (announcement of one's name) of waki (supporting role) (TAIRA no Munemori).
It is the heyday of the Taira family; the play starts with a spirited nanori (announcement of one's name) of the waki (supporting role) (TAIRA no Munemori).
It is the heyday of the Taira family; the play starts with a spirited nanori (announcement of one's name) of the waki (supporting role) (TAIRA no Munemori).

sen.j: 宗盛には愛妾熊野（シテ）がいるが、その母の病が重くなったとの手紙が届いた。
sen.e: Munemori's favorite concubine, called Yuya (shite [main role]), receives a letter telling that her mother's condition has worsened.
Munemori's favorite concubine, Yuya (shite [main role]), receives a letter telling her that her mother's condition has worsened.
sen.cmt: Calledを削除しました。Herを追加しました。
sen.e: Munemori's favorite concubine, Yuya (shite [main role]), receives a letter telling her that her mother's condition has worsened.

sen.j: 弱気な母の手紙を読み、熊野は故郷の遠江国に顔を出したいと宗盛に願う。
sen.e: Having read her mother's bearish letter, she asks Munemori to excuse her to visit her home in Totomi Province.
Having read her weakened mother's letter, she asks Munemori to excuse her to visit her home in Totomi Province.
sen.cmt: bearishをweakenedに変え、手紙ではなく母を形容しました。
sen.e: Having read her weakened mother's letter, she asks Munemori to excuse her to visit her home in Totomi Province.

sen.j: だが、宗盛はせめてこのサクラは熊野と共に見たい、またそれで熊野を元気づけようと考える（「この春ばかりの花見の友と思ひ留め置きて候」）。
sen.e: However, Munemori would like to see this cherry blossom with Yura and cheer up her.

However, Munemori would like to see this year's cherry blossoms together with Yuya, and thinks of cheering her up with the view ("At least this spring, I think of her as my companion to view the cherry blossoms, and keep her by my side").
sen.cmt: Blossomを複数にしました。Cheer up herをthinks of cheering her up with the viewにしました。以下を参照して詩の英訳を追加しました。http://homepage2.nifty.com/~bunko/kyoku/217yuya2.htm
sen.e: However, Munemori would like to see this year's cherry blossoms together with Yuya, and thinks of cheering her up with the view ("At least this spring, I think of her as my companion to view the cherry blossoms, and keep her by my side").

sen.j: 熊野の心は母を思い鬱々としながらも、道行きに見る春の京の姿にも目を喜ばせる。
sen.e: Yuya feels depressed thinking about her mother although she enjoys seeing spring scenery of Kyoto on the way.
Although Yuya feels depressed thinking about her mother, the sight of Kyoto in spring that she sees along the way brings joy to her eyes.
sen.cmt: 原文により忠実になるよう訳し直しました。
sen.e: Although Yuya feels depressed thinking about her mother, the sight of Kyoto in spring that she sees along the way brings joy to her eyes.

sen.j: やがて牛車は清水寺に着いた。
sen.e: Then gissha (ox-drawn carriage) arrives at Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
Eventually, the gissha (ox-drawn carriage) arrives at Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
Eventually, the gissha (ox-drawn carriage) arrives at Kiyomizu-dera Temple.

sen.j: 花見の宴会が始まる。
sen.e: The banquet of cherry blossom viewing has started.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The banquet for cherry blossom viewing starts.
sen.cmt: Ofをforにしました。時制を原文と同じにしました。
sen.e: The banquet for cherry blossom viewing starts.

sen.j: 一方熊野は仏堂で祈りを捧げる。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Yuya prays at Buddhist temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Yuya prays at the Buddhist temple.
Meanwhile, Yuya prays at the Buddhist temple.

sen.j: やがて熊野は呼び出され、自分の女主人としての役割を思い出す。
sen.e: Then Yuya is called and recalls her duty as a mistress.
Yuya is eventually called to the banquet, and recalls her duty as a mistress.
sen.cmt: Thenを削除しました。Eventuallyを追加しました。To the banquetを追加しました。
sen.e: Yuya is eventually called to the banquet, and recalls her duty as a mistress.

sen.j: 宗盛に勧められ花見の一座を喜ばせようと、心ならずも熊野は桜の頃の清水を讃えながら舞（中ノ舞）を舞う。
sen.e: Yuya reluctantly dances (Naka-no-mai [middle dance]) admiring cherry blossom season of Kiyomizu to please the guests as Munemori has requested.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: At Munemori's suggestion and in order to please the guests viewing the cherry blossoms, Yuya reluctantly performs a dance (Naka-no-mai [middle dance]) praising Kiyomizu in cherry blossom season.
sen.cmt: 原文により忠実になるよう順序を変えました。
sen.e: At Munemori's suggestion and in order to please the guests viewing the cherry blossoms, Yuya reluctantly performs a dance (Naka-no-mai [middle dance]) praising Kiyomizu in cherry blossom season.

sen.j: しかし折悪しく村雨が花を散らす。
sen.e: However, unfortunately a passing shower makes blossom fall.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, unfortunately a passing shower scatters the blossoms.
sen.cmt: Blossomを複数にしました。Make~fallをscattersにしました。
sen.e: However, unfortunately a passing shower scatters the blossoms.

sen.j: それを見た熊野は、歌を詠む。
sen.e: Yuya see it and makes a poem.
Seeing this, Yuya makes a poem.
Seeing this, Yuya makes a poem.

sen.j: いかにせん都の春も惜しけれど、馴れし東の花や散るらん
sen.e: What can I do; although spring of Kyoto is regrettable, familiar blossom in east is falling.
What can I do; although the spring of Kyoto is also beautiful, the blossoms in the familiar East are falling
What can I do; although the spring of Kyoto is also beautiful, the blossoms in the familiar East are falling

sen.j: 宗盛もこれには感じ入り、その場で暇を許す。
sen.e: Munemori is deeply touched by this and immediately allows her to spare time.
Munemori is deeply touched by this and immediately allows her to take time off.
sen.cmt: Spare timeをtake time offにしました。
sen.e: Munemori is deeply touched by this and immediately allows her to take time off.

sen.j: 熊野は観世音の功徳と感謝し、宗盛の気が変わらない内にとすぐさま故郷を目指し出立する。
sen.e: Yuya is grateful for virtuous deed of Kanzeon and quickly departs to home before Munemori changes his mind.
Yuya is grateful for what she considers a virtuous deed of Kanzeon and quickly departs for her home town before Munemori has a chance to change his mind.
sen.cmt: 原文により忠実になるよう意訳し直しました。
sen.e: Yuya is grateful for what she considers a virtuous deed of Kanzeon and quickly departs for her home town before Munemori has a chance to change his mind.

sen.j: 「東路さして行く道の。」
sen.e: "Headding to the east.
"On the way to the eastern country,
sen.cmt: 以下参照の解説に合わせて訳したので、改行は原文に合っていません。http://www2u.biglobe.ne.jp/~houmei/kasi/yuya.htm
sen.e: On the way to the eastern country,'
sen.cmt: 原文に「」を、訳文に''を補足しました。

sen.j: 「やがて休ろう逢坂の。」
sen.e: Then resting at Mt. Osaka.
The guard at the gate of Osaka, where Yuya was eventually to rest,
sen.cmt: 以下参照の解説に合わせて訳したので、改行は原文に合っていません。http://www2u.biglobe.ne.jp/~houmei/kasi/yuya.htm
sen.e: The guard at the gate of Osaka, where Yuya was eventually to rest,'
sen.cmt: 原文に「」を、訳文に''を補足しました。

sen.j: 「関の戸ざしも心して。」
sen.e: The gatekeeper understands the situation.
Sympathized with her devotion and opened the gate,
sen.cmt: 以下参照の解説に合わせて訳したので、改行は原文に合っていません。http://www2u.biglobe.ne.jp/~houmei/kasi/yuya.htm
sen.e: Sympathized with her devotion and opened the gate,'
sen.cmt: 原文に「」を、訳文に''を補足しました。

sen.j: 「明けゆく跡の山見えて。」
sen.e: Looking back the mountains at dawn.
As the sun rose Mt. Osaka could be seen,
sen.cmt: 以下参照の解説に合わせて訳したので、改行は原文に合っていません。http://www2u.biglobe.ne.jp/~houmei/kasi/yuya.htm
sen.e: As the sun rose Mt. Osaka could be seen,'
sen.cmt: 原文に「」を、訳文に''を補足しました。

sen.j: 「花を見捨つるかりがねの。」
sen.e: The geese give up the flowers.
Where the geese leaving the city's flower's behind are headed.
sen.cmt: 以下参照の解説に合わせて訳したので、改行は原文に合っていません。http://www2u.biglobe.ne.jp/~houmei/kasi/yuya.htm
sen.e: Where the geese leaving the city's flower's behind are headed.'
sen.cmt: 原文に「」を、訳文に''を補足しました。

sen.j: 「それは越路われはまた。」
sen.e: It goes to Koshi and so do I.
That is the northern land of Koshi,
sen.cmt: 以下参照の解説に合わせて訳したので、改行は原文に合っていません。http://www2u.biglobe.ne.jp/~houmei/kasi/yuya.htm
sen.e: That is the northern land of Koshi,'
sen.cmt: 原文に「」を、訳文に''を補足しました。

sen.j: 「あずまに帰る名残かな。」
sen.e: Coming back to the east but missing Kyoto.
Is it reluctance I feel at returning to the east,
sen.cmt: 以下参照の解説に合わせて訳したので、改行は原文に合っていません。http://www2u.biglobe.ne.jp/~houmei/kasi/yuya.htm
sen.e: Is it reluctance I feel at returning to the east,'
sen.cmt: 原文に「」を、訳文に''を補足しました。

sen.j: 「あずまに帰る名残かな。」
sen.e: Coming back to the east but missing Kyoto.
Is it reluctance I feel at returning to the east."
sen.cmt: 以下参照の解説に合わせて訳したので、改行は原文に合っていません。http://www2u.biglobe.ne.jp/~houmei/kasi/yuya.htm
sen.e: Is it reluctance I feel at returning to the east.'
sen.cmt: 原文に「」を、訳文に''を補足しました。

sen.j: （トメ拍子）。
sen.e: (Tome-hyoshi [closing stamps]).
(Tome-hyoshi [closing stamps]).
(Tome-hyoshi [closing stamps]).

tit.cmt: タイトルなので大文字にしました。

sen.j: 熊野の墓
sen.e: Grave of Yuya
Grave of Yuya
Grave of Yuya

sen.j: 行興寺 静岡県磐田市池田 ()
sen.e: Gyoko-ji Temple, Ikeda, Iwata City, Shizuoka Prefecture
Gyoko-ji Temple, Ikeda, Iwata City, Shizuoka Prefecture
Gyoko-ji Temple, Ikeda, Iwata City, Shizuoka Prefecture

sen.j: 熊野御前の命日である5月3日に合わせ、毎年、熊野の長藤まつりが行われる。
sen.e: Yuya no Nagafuji Matsuri is held annually on May 3, the anniversary of Kumano Gozen's death.
Yuya no Nagafuji Matsuri is held annually on May 3, the death anniversary of Yuya Gozen's death.
sen.cmt: Deathを追加しました。熊野の発音をゆやで統一しました。参照：http://otakara-iwata.net/index.php?FUNC=Detail&Id=177
sen.e: Yuya no Nagafuji Matsuri is held annually on May 3, the death anniversary of Yuya Gozen's death.

sen.j: 国指定天然記念物でもあるこの藤には、熊野が植えたとの言い伝えがある。
sen.e: There is a legend that Yuya planted the wisteria, which is a designated national natural treasure.
There is a legend that Yuya planted the wisteria, which is a designated national natural treasure.
There is a legend that Yuya planted the wisteria, which is a designated national natural treasure.

tit.cmt: タイトルなので大文字にしました。

sen.j: CD 能楽「熊野」コロムビアミュージックエンタテインメント 演能形式でほとんど全曲を収録。
sen.e: Nohgaku theatre "Yuya" Columbia Music Entertainment: Nearly all music is included in Noh performance style.
CD: Nohgaku theatre "Yuya," Columbia Music Entertainment: Nearly all the music is included, in Noh performance style.
sen.cmt: Cdを追加しました。Theaterをアメリカ綴りにしました。コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: CD: Nohgaku theatre "Yuya," Columbia Music Entertainment: Nearly all the music is included, in Noh performance style.

tit.cmt: タイトルなので大文字にしました。

sen.j: 平家物語の巻十、海道下(かいどうくだり)の場面から発展させたと思われる。
sen.e: It seemingly expands on the scenes from "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike) Vol.10 'Kaidokudari.'
The story seemingly expands on the scenes from "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike) Vol.10 'Kaidokudari.'
sen.cmt: 新しいセクションなのでItをthe storyにしました。
sen.e: The story seemingly expands on the scenes from "Heike Monogatari" (The Tale of the Heike) Vol.10 'Kaidokudari.'

sen.j: 山田検校作の山田流箏曲『熊野』の他、長唄、河東節、一中節の素材にも用いられた。
sen.e: It was adapted to Yamada school's koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) music "Yuya," by Kenkyo YAMADA, nagauta (long epic song with shamisen accompaniment), Kato bushi (theatrical music) and itchubushi.

It was adapted to Yamada school's koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) music "Yuya" by Kenkyo YAMADA, nagauta (epic song with shamisen accompaniment), Kato bushi (theatrical music) and itchubushi (style of shamisen music).
sen.cmt: コンマを削除しました。Longを削除しました。一中節の説明を追加しました。
sen.e: It was adapted to Yamada school's koto (a long Japanese zither with thirteen strings) music "Yuya" by Kenkyo YAMADA, nagauta (epic song with shamisen accompaniment), Kato bushi (theatrical music) and itchubushi (style of shamisen music).

sen.j: 三島由紀夫の『近代能楽集』で取り上げられた。
sen.e: It is featured on "Modern Noh Plays" written by Yukio MISHIMA.
It was featured in "Modern Noh Plays" written by Yukio MISHIMA.
sen.cmt: 時制を修正しました。Onをinにしました。
sen.e: It was featured in "Modern Noh Plays" written by Yukio MISHIMA.
